title: John Patton - The Organization! (1963-70) [Jazz][mp3 320][h33t][
description:
John Patton - The Organization! The Best of 'Big' John Patton
Year: 1963-70
Label: Blue Note (1994)
Total time: 78:03
Bitrage: 320 kbps

Super 78-minute anthology of Patton's prime (1963-70) era, unfortunately released only in the U.K., drawn from nine albums. 1963's 

"Along Came John," and 1966's "Amanda," and the two cuts from his best album, 1965's Let 'Em Roll ( "The Turnaround" and 

"Latona" ) are particular cookers, but the organ-guitar-horn groove is always solid, and the riffs basic but compelling.  This is some of 

the best soul-jazz ever, usually featuring Grant Green on guitar, though a young James Ulmer takes over on axe for the 1970-era cuts. 

~ Richie Unterberger, AMG

Personnel:
John Patton (Organ) 
Grant Green (Guitar) - 1-9 
Ben Dixon (Drums) - 1-6 
Fred Jackson (Tenor Saxophone) - 1,2,4 
Harold Vick (Tenor Saxophone) - 1,2,6 
George Braith (Soprano Saxophone and Strich) - 3,5 
Tommy Turrentine (Trumpet) - 3,5 
Richard Williams (Trumpet) - 4 
Blue Mitchell (Trumpet) - 6 
Hugh Walker (Drums) - 7,10 
Richard Landrum (Conga) - 7 
Bobby Hutcherson (Vibes) - 8,9 
Otis Finch (Drums) - 8,9 
Harold Alexander (Flute and Tenor Saxophone) - 10 
Marvin Cabell (Flute and Tenor Saxophone, Saxello) - 11,12 
James Ulmer (Guitar) - 11,12 
Larry Hancock (Drums) - 11 
Leroy Williams (Drums) - 12
